During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.

Education Secretary Michael Gove said: Under the last government, thousands of great people left teaching because behaviour was out of control and they were forced to spend far too much time on paperwork. "That's why we're acting to restore discipline and reduce bureaucracy. Mr Michael Gove said that every school day nearly 1,000 pupils are suspended for abuse and assault. So teachers take up more responsibility for policing the nations underage riff raff while they're on school premises...

Mr Justice Holman, sitting in London, allowed the challenges by the councils, declaring Mr Michael Gove had unlawfully failed to consult them before imposing the cuts.
